title: Simple, clean, works every time

For me, it was controlling music from anywhere in my house without needing line of sight to the receiver, or the remote to the stereo. With this app, I can do just that. The developer is among the best I've ever seen- personalized help and follows through all the way to when you have the solution.

One issue with new layout I have had is the speakers select window is not letting me change or manage speakers.  It closes to an "OK" window. It'd be great if I could just have it play one album, rather than it queuing every album by the same artist after the first. (For instance, putting Abbey Road on will add every Beatles album after that as well.)  Edit: Apparently it just queues every track after the one you choose... kind of annoying.

title: Works great with iTunes
comment: Not sure why iTunes isn't mentioned in the description, but TunesRemote+ works great with it.  I tried pairing several other iTunes remotes from the Android Market, but none of them would successfully connect. I had the same problem initially with TunesRemote, but luckily it has a manual configuration option that worked great (none of the other apps I tried have that feature). Just bring up manual config from the menu and specify the IP address of the system where iTunes is running.  Even better, TunesRemote seems to have the best feature set.
